summary: This document is a court opinion regarding a case where the United States sought to evict Jeffrey E. Epstein and Ivan S. Fisher from a property formerly used as a residence by the Deputy Consul General of Iran. The court ruled in favor of the Government, granting summary judgment for ejectment based on the failure of Epstein to obtain proper consent for subletting the premises.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the primary defendant in the case, having leased the premises from the Office of Foreign Missions and subletting it to Fisher without proper consent.

persons.name: Ivan S. Fisher
persons.context: Fisher is a co-defendant who sublet the premises from Epstein and is involved in the legal dispute regarding the eviction.

persons.name: Mary Jo White
persons.context: White represents the United States in the case against Epstein and Fisher.

persons.name: Serene K. Nakano
persons.context: Nakano is assisting in the prosecution of the case on behalf of the United States.

persons.name: Steven J. Cohen
persons.context: Cohen represents Epstein in the legal proceedings.

persons.name: G. Robert Gage, Jr.
persons.context: Gage represents Fisher and others in the case.

persons.name: Ellyn Bank
persons.context: Bank is one of the subtenants added as a defendant in the case.

persons.name: Debra Elisa Cohen
persons.context: Cohen is another subtenant involved in the case.

persons.name: Diane Fisher
persons.context: Fisher is involved in the case as a subtenant.

persons.name: Lawrence D. Gerzog
persons.context: Gerzog is listed as a subtenant in the case.

persons.name: Robert Heilbrun
persons.context: Heilbrun is a subtenant involved in the legal proceedings.

persons.context: Siegel is another subtenant listed in the case.

persons.name: Ron Soffer
persons.context: Soffer is a subtenant who has not agreed to the stipulation regarding the case.

persons.name: Carmen Tausik
persons.context: Tausik is listed as a subtenant in the case.

events.title: Termination of Lease
events.description: The Office of Foreign Missions notified Epstein that the lease would be terminated due to failure to cure defaults.

events.title: Sublease Agreement
events.description: Epstein and Fisher entered into a sublease agreement despite OFM's denial of consent.

events.title: Alleged Oral Consent
events.description: Epstein claims that OFM orally consented to the sublet to Fisher during a phone call.

events.title: Notice to Fisher
events.description: OFM informed Fisher that the lease agreement had been terminated and demanded he vacate the premises.

events.title: Notice of Default
events.description: OFM sent Epstein a notice of default for violating the lease terms.

keyFacts: The United States sought to evict Epstein and Fisher from a property formerly used as a residence by the Deputy Consul General of Iran.
Epstein sublet the premises to Fisher without obtaining the necessary consent from the Office of Foreign Missions.
The court ruled that the lease required written consent for subletting, making any oral consent invalid.
The Government's motion for summary judgment for ejectment was granted against Epstein and Fisher.
The case involved multiple subtenants who were added as defendants after the Government learned of their illegal occupancy.
